properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A frontal system will approach northern Vancouver Island tonight generating strong southeast winds. Winds will rise to southeast 90 km/h over exposed coastal sections near midnight and then ease late overnight with the passage of the front. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-04T04:52:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-03T12:52:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1786685575.2021
Area: North Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snowfall with blowing snow is expected. Heavy snowfall with blowing snow continues. Total snowfall: 20 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 80 - 90 km/h. Locations: southeastern Avalon. Time span: continuing into this afternoon. Remarks: Snowfall accumulations have come in higher than expected and have reached Winter Storm Warning criteria. Strong winds will combine with fresh fallen snow to create poor visibility in blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve late in the afternoon with the snow tapering off to flurries. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-01-03T20:02:26-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-03T13:47:26-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4021213649.2021
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southeast
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T16:16:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-03T00:16:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2990119015.2021
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A Pacific disturbance moving across the Columbias will continue to bring significant snow accumulations to the Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass section tonight. Snow at times heavy is forecast for tonight and another 10 to 20 cm can be expected to accumulate by Sunday morning as conditions gradually tapers off to periods of snow. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T16:16:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-03T00:16:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4081027959.2021
Area: Trans-Canada Highway - Eagle Pass to Rogers Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong winds are continuing in a few locations, but will weaken this morning. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 25 to 30 cm is expected. Locations: Nova Scotia Time span: gradually ending west to east tonight. Remarks: Generally 15 to 25 centimeters of snow is expected by the time the snow ends tonight. Furthermore, strong east to northeast winds gusting to 60 to 70 km/h may reduce visibility in blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Heavy snowfall accumulation may cause tree branches to break. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T15:14:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-01-03T05:39:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1872803230.2021

properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing drizzle is ongoing early this morning. Freezing drizzle will continue. Black ice was reported earlier this morning. The freezing drizzle will switch to snow this morning, though accumulations should be limited to 5 cm or less. Hazards: Freezing drizzle Timing: Freezing drizzle switching to snow Impacts: Dangerous driving conditions due to black ice ### Freezing drizzle advisories are issued when drizzle falling in sub-zero temperatures is expected to freeze on contact, and over time create icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Temperatures near minus 40 degrees Celsius combined with 15 to 30 km/h winds are expected to generate wind chill values near -55 tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing drizzle is ongoing across much of southwestern Ontario early this morning. Hazards: Freezing drizzle Timing: Freezing drizzle will continue into this morning before switching over to snow Impacts: Dangerous driving conditions due to black ice Discussion: Freezing drizzle has been ongoing for much of the night and black ice was reported earlier this morning as well. The freezing drizzle will switch to snow this morning...though accumulations should be limited to 5 cm or less, even small amounts of snow on top of black ice can create dangerous driving conditions. ### Freezing drizzle advisories are issued when drizzle falling in sub-zero temperatures is expected to freeze on contact, and over time create icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-01-03T16:59:15-00:00
